Importer.le_rootdir:
Specify the filepath to the root folder of your study.
For example: /home/jsmith/MyStudy/source
Importer.chk_uselegacy:
Specify whether the legacy import should be used (CHECKED)
OR whether the newer BIDS import should be used (UNCHECKED)
Importer.lab_holdersub:
This label tells the importer that a directory level contains subject information
A subject is a person or animal participating in the study
Importer.lab_holdervisit:
This label tells the importer that a directory level contains visit information.
A visit is a logical grouping of neuroimaging data acquired during the presence of
a subject at the site of the study (i.e baseline, 1-year followup, etc.)
Importer.lab_holderrun:
This label tells the importer that a directory level contains run information.
A run is an uninterrupted repetition of data acquisition with the same parameters
during a visit
Importer.lab_holderscan:
This label tells the importer that a directory level contains scan information.
A scan is an acquisition of neuroimaging data at using particular scanner machine
parameters (i.e arterial spin labelling, T1-weighted imaging, etc.)
Importer.lab_holderdummy:
This label tells the importer that a directory level contains no important information
and that this level should be skipped over when discerning folder structure
Importer.cmb_runposition: Indicates the relative positioning this run has relative to the others in the event that run order is important to the study
Importer.le_runalias:
Indicates the run name that the folder indicated on the left should take on after being
imported. If not specified, the name of this folder will be ASL_

Dehybridizer.le_rootdir:
The path to the root directory that will have a backup made prior to an expansion
and which tells the program where to begin looking.
Dehybridizer.btn_setrootdir:
Specify the path to the root directory through a file dialogue rather than by
drag and drop
Dehybridizer.le_exampledir:
Specify any directory that is an example of what must be expanded. This tells
the program the relative folder depth at which sibling folders can be found
Dehybridizer.btn_exampledir:
Specify the path to the example directory through a file dialogue rather than
by drag and drop
Dehybridizer.le_delimiter:
Specify whether there is a character that separates two pieces of information
found at the indicated directory. For example subject_session is separated by
 '_' delimiter
Dehybridizer.btn_fill_spaces:
Click to extract all relevant folder names at the indicated level,
separating names as appropriate if a delimiter was specified
Dehybridizer.le_autofill: Enter text in this field that you wish to be present in all rows.
Dehybridizer.name2le:
Specify the name of the parent folder that the indicated
child folder should be placed under

ParmsMaker.le_easl_dir:
Specify the filepath to the ExploreASL folder located on your machine.
Example: /home/jsmith/MATLAB/ExploreASL
ParmsMaker.le_studyname: Specify the name of the study you would like it to have
ParmsMaker.chk_overwrite_for_bids:
Specify whether the study dataset is in BIDS format (CHECKED)
OR whether the study dataset is in the older legacy format (UNCHECKED)
ParmsMaker.le_study_dir:
Specify the filepath to the raw folder of your study.
For example: /home/jsmith/MyStudy/derivatives
ParmsMaker.lst_included_subjects: Drag and Drop the subjects that should be analyzed
ParmsMaker.lst_excluded_subjects: Drag and Drop the subjects that should be excluded from the analysis
ParmsMaker.cmb_vendor: Specify the Vendor of the scans in the analysis folder
ParmsMaker.cmb_sequencetype: Specify the imaging sequence utilized during scan acquisition
ParmsMaker.cmb_labelingtype: Specify the labelling strategy used during ASL scan acquisition
ParmsMaker.cmb_m0_isseparate:
Specify whether a proton density scan (M0) was acquired
If a scan was not acquired, the mean control ASL image set
will be used as a substitute.
ParmsMaker.cmb_m0_posinasl:
If a proton density (M0) scan was acquired, specify its location.
This argument is ignored if the user has indicated that an M0 scan
was not acquired
ParmsMaker.cmb_quality:
Indicate the precision with which certain processing steps should be taken, such
as segmentation. Higher quality results in longer processing times.
ParmsMaker.cmb_nsup_pulses:
Specify the number of background suppression pulses that were utilized
for ASL scans in your study
ParmsMaker.cmb_readout_dim: Specify the dimension of ASL acquisitions as they came off the scanner
ParmsMaker.le_sup_pulse_vec:
Specify a vector containing the timings, in seconds,
of the background suppression pulses before the
start of the readout. For multiple pulses,
separate numbers entires by a comma.

Example: 1.14, 2.55
ParmsMaker.spinbox_initialpld:
Specify the time, in milliseconds, of the post-label delay.
- For 3D scans this is fixed for the whole brain
- For 2D scans this is the post-label delay of the FIRST acquired slice
ParmsMaker.spinbox_labdur: Specify the time, in milliseconds, of the pulse labeling period.
ParmsMaker.spinbox_slice_readout:
Specify the value of the time added to the PLD after each slice
This is required for 2D readout ASL acquisitions
ParmsMaker.spinbox_lambda: Specify the blood/brain water coefficient (0.9 in Alsop MRM 2014)
ParmsMaker.spinbox_artt2: Specify the T2* of the arterial blood at 3T
ParmsMaker.spinbox_bloodt1: Specify the T1 relaxation time of arterial blood at 3T (1650 in Alsop MRM 2014)
ParmsMaker.spinbox_tissuet1: Specify the T1 relaxation time of grey matter tissue at 3T 1240 in Alsop MRM 2014)
ParmsMaker.chk_quant_applyss_asl:
Specify whether to apply scale slopes to the ASL volume (checked)
or omit this step (unchecked)
ParmsMaker.chk_quant_applyss_m0:
Specify whether to apply scale slopes to the M0 volume (checked)
or omit this step (unchecked)
ParmsMaker.chk_quant_pwi2label:
Specify whether to convert PWI arbitrary units to label units (checked)
or omit this step (unchecked)
ParmsMaker.chk_quant_quantifym0:
Specify whether to quantify the M0 arbitrary units (checked)
or omit this step (unchecked)
ParmsMaker.chk_quant_divbym0:
Specify whether to perform the division calculation by the M0 image (checked)
or omit this step (unchecked)
ParmsMaker.chk_save_cbf4d:
Specify whether to also save the 4D CBF timeseries if the ASL volume was a timeseries (checked)
 or omit this step (unchecked)
ParmsMaker.cmb_ncomparts: Specify the number of compartments to model during quantification
ParmsMaker.cmb_m0_algorithm: Specify whether to use the newer M0 processing algorithm or the standard one
ParmsMaker.spinbox_gmscale:
Specify whether the M0 image should be multiplied by a specific factor.
This is useful when you have background suppression but no M0 image acquired
without suppression. If you know the M0 scalefactor, you can use the control
image as M0 and apply this factor to scale back what was suppressed by the
background suppression
ParmsMaker.chk_removespikes:
Specify whether images that are motion outliers should be
discarded (checked) or left alone (unchecked)
ParmsMaker.spinbox_spikethres: Specify the minimum T-statistic required to define a motion spike
ParmsMaker.chk_motioncorrect:
Specify whether to perform motion correction on the
ASL timeseries (checked) or omit this step (unchecked)
ParmsMaker.chk_deltempfiles:
Specify whether to delete temporary files created
during a pipeline (checked) or retain them (unchecked)
ParmsMaker.chk_skipnoflair:
Specify whether to omit the processing of any subjects
missing FLAIR acquisitions (checked) or proceed anyway (unchecked)
ParmsMaker.chk_skipnoasl:
Specify whether to omit the processing of any subjects
missing ASL acquisitions (checked) or proceed anyway (unchecked)
ParmsMaker.chk_skipnom0:
Specify whether to omit the processing of any subjects
missing M0 acquisitions (checked) or proceed anyway (unchecked)
ParmsMaker.cmb_segmethod: Specify which underlying software to use during T1 image segmentation
ParmsMaker.chk_runlongreg:
Specify whether to run Longitudinal Registration (checked)
or stick to cross-sectional (unchecked)
ParmsMaker.chk_run_dartel:
Specify whether to run the DARTEL algorithm (checked)
or omit this step (unchecked)
ParmsMaker.chk_hammersroi:
Specify whether CAT12 should provide Hammers volumetric ROI results (checked)
or omit this step (unchecked)
ParmsMaker.chk_fixcat12res:
Specify whether image need to be resampled to a resolution that CAT12 (checked)
or not (unchecked)
ParmsMaker.cmb_imgcontrast: Specify which image contrast is used for registration
ParmsMaker.cmb_affineregbase:
Specify if the ASL-T1w rigid-body registration is followed up by an affine registration:
1) Based on PWI CoV - affine registration is conditionally enabled based on the spatial CoV of the PWI
2) Enabled - affine registration is always enabled
3) Disabled - affine registration is always disabled
ParmsMaker.cmb_dctreg: Specify whether to use DCT registration on top of affine registration
ParmsMaker.chk_regm0toasl:
Specify whether, if a separate M0 is available, to
register it to the mean control ASL image
ParmsMaker.chk_usemniasdummy:
Specify whether, if a T1w image is missing, to
utilize the MNI template as a stand-in (checked)
or omit this (unchecked)
ParmsMaker.chk_nativepvc:
Perform PV-Correction (checked) in ASL native space using the GM and WM maps
obtained from previously segmented T1-weighted images.
Otherwise, omit this step (unchecked)
ParmsMaker.chk_gaussianpvc: PV-correction with a Gaussian (checked) instead of square kernel (unchecked)
ParmsMaker.spinbox_pvckernel_1: Size of the kernel's first dimension, in voxels
ParmsMaker.spinbox_pvckernel_2: Size of the kernel's second dimension, in voxels
ParmsMaker.spinbox_pvckernel_3: Size of the kernel's third dimension, in voxels
ParmsMaker.le_fslpath:
Specify the path to the FSL bin directory
(i.e. /usr/local/fsl/bin/fsl
ParmsMaker.chk_suscepmask:
Specify whether to mask an ROI using the susceptibility mask (checked)
 or omit this step (unchecked)
ParmsMaker.chk_subjectvasmask:
Specify whether to mask an ROI using the subject's vascular mask (checked)
or omit this step (unchecked)
ParmsMaker.chk_subjecttismask:
Specify whether to mask an ROI using the subject's tissue mask (checked)
or omit this step (unchecked)
ParmsMaker.chk_wholebrainmask:
Specify whether to mask an ROI using the subject's wholebrain mask (checked)
or omit this step (unchecked)
ParmsMaker.btn_load_parms: Loads in an existent DataPar.json file to auto-fill in all avaliable widgets

Executor.inner_cmb_ncores:
Specify the number of cores to allocate to this study.
Important points:
	-DO NOT specify more cores than there are subjects for the study
	-DO NOT specify more than one core for a study that will have the 
	Population Module run on it
Executor.inner_le:
Specify the filepath to the root folder of your study.
For example: /home/jsmith/MyStudy/derivatives
Executor.inner_cmb_procopts:
Specify which ExploreASL module to run:
	-Structural: Structural Module for processing T1w and FLAIR scans
	-ASL: ASL Module for processing ASL and M0 scans
	-Both: Run both the Structural and ASL modules
	-Population: Population module for determining statistics,
	studywide masks, etc.
Executor.cmb_modjob:
Specify the type of re-run or pre-processing modification you'd like to perform.
Currently the following options are avaliable:
	'Re-run a study': Re-run parts of a previously-run study
	'Alter participants.tsv': Add metadata to the tsv file such that biasfields for
	that metadata may be created when running the Population module

Modjob_RerunPrep.lock_tree:
Indicate which parts of the pipeline should be re-run for which 
modules/subjects/runs/etc.
This window will delete all created .status files with the lock
directory for the selected folders & files. When ExploreASL is
re-run, it will detect these missing .status files and interpret
that as a signal to re-run that particular section of the study's
pipeline.

Modjob_MergeDirs.spin_nsrcdirs: Indicate the number of studies that should be merged together.
Modjob_MergeDirs.chk_symlinks:
Indicate whether the merge directory should be real directories (unchecked) or symbolic pointers to real files (checked).
The latter saves diskspace at the detriment of depending on the original file existing.
Modjob_MergeDirs.chk_overwrite: Indicate whether existing files in the merge destination should be overwritten during the merge operation (checked) or skipped (unchecked).
Modjob_MergeDirs.le_mergedst:
Indicate the path to the merge directory.
For example: /home/jsmith/MergeStudies/derivatives
Modjob_MergeDirs.le_studypath:
Specify the filepath to the root folder of your study.
For example: /home/jsmith/MyStudy/derivatives

Modjob_ModSidecars.le_fromfile:
Indicate the path to the .csv or .tsv file specifying key-values to insert
into the json sidecars of subjects specified within said file
Modjob_ModSidecars.lst_subs:
Drag and Drop the directories of the subjects whose sidecars
should be altered with the user-specified key and value
Modjob_ModSidecars.le_key: The key (i.e. M0_GMScaleFactor) that should be inserted into json sidecars
Modjob_ModSidecars.le_value: The value that the indicated key within the json sidecar should take on
Modjob_ModSidecars.cmb_actiontype: The specific action the user wishes to perform on the json sidecars

Modjob_TSValter.le_metadatafile:
Indicate the path to the metadata file (.csv, .tsv, or .xlsx)
whose values should be transferred into participants.tsv
Modjob_TSValter.btn_loadmetadata:
This will load in the metadata from the metadata file
and display the column names within the list widget below
Modjob_TSValter.lst_metadata:
These are the column names detected in the metadata file.
Drag and drop the columns whose data should be transferred
into the adjacent participants.tsv list widget
Modjob_TSValter.le_metadata_subjectcol:
This must be the name of the column describing
subjects in the metadata file
Modjob_TSValter.lst_parttsv:
These are the column names that will be saved to participants.tsv
Drag and drop the column names from the metadata list widget
into this list widget to indicate which columns of
metadata should be transferred
Modjob_TSValter.le_parttsv_subjectcol:
This must be the name of the column describing
subjects in the participants.tsv file
Modjob_TSValter.btn_reset:
This will restore all columns moved from the metadata list
to the participants.tsv list back to their original position
Modjob_TSValter.btn_altertsv: This will alter participants.tsv with the new data from the metadata file
Modjob_TSValter.btn_revert:
In the event that the user wishes to completely undo a participants.tsv
alteration, this will consume the backup participants_orig.tsv in order
to restore the original.

Plotting.le_analysis_dir:
Specify the filepath to the root folder of your study.
For example: /home/jsmith/MyStudy/derivatives
Plotting.le_metadata: Specify the filepath to the metadata file. This should be either a .csv, .tsv. or .xlsx file
Plotting.cmb_atlas_selection: Select which atlas the CBF values should be based on
Plotting.cmb_pvc_selection:
Select whether the CBF values should be based on
partial-volume correction or uncorrected
Plotting.btn_subset_data:
This will open a window to allow you to subset the loaded data on based on
levels in a categorical variable
Plotting.btn_indicate_dtype:
This will open a window to allow you to correct the program's
interpretation of the datatype of a particular variable
(i.e Sex encoded by 1s and 0s may be misinterpreted as a numerical type)
Plotting.btn_load_in_data: This will load in the data from the indicated analysis directory
Plotting.lst_varview:
This area houses the variables extracted from column headers found within the
study's dataframes as well as any metadata loaded in by the user
Plotting.cmb_figuretypeselection:
This will select the type of plotting submodule to use.
Options include:
- Facet Grid: for standard plotting (i.e Box Plots)
- Plot & MRI View: for selecting ASL and T1w scans from datapoints
